organization.fullName: Jose R. Reyes Memorial Medical Center

identificationModule.briefTitle: Stroke Unit in the Philippines: Is it Effective
identificationModule.officialTitle: Stroke Unit in the Philippines: Is it Effective?

responsibleParty.investigatorTitle: Chairman Emeritus, Department of Neurology, Principal Investigator
responsibleParty.investigatorAffiliation: Jose R. Reyes Memorial Medical Center

leadSponsor.name: Jose R. Reyes Memorial Medical Center

descriptionModule.briefSummary: This study aims to assess the effectiveness of Stroke Unit in the Philippines by comparing the functional outcome between those patient admitted in the general neurology wards and stroke units using modified Rankin Scale
descriptionModule.detailedDescription: This study aims to look into functionality of patient admitted in the stroke unit in the Philippines

secondaryOutcomes.measure: Functional outcome in modified rankin scale

eligibilityModule.eligibilityCriteria:
Inclusion Criteria:

* All consecutive patients admitted in participating SUs starting June 2016 during acute stroke (within 7 days from onset), either hemorrhagic or ischemic stroke confirmed by CT-Scan or MRI, will be included

Exclusion Criteria:

* Patient who had previous of stroke and secondary cause of intracerebral hemorrhage such as trauma, arteriovenous malformation and aneurysm are not included in the study. Those who transferred from other institutions will be excluded. And also, patients who are below 18 years old are excluded in the study
eligibilityModule.studyPopulation: all consecutive patients diagnosed with stroke (ischemic and hemorrhagic) starting on June 2016.

overallOfficials.name: Jose C Navarro, MD
overallOfficials.affiliation: Jose R. Reyes Memorial Medical Center

locations.facility: Jose R. Reyes Memorial Medical Center
